panels.description: Only distinguishes between online, offline and asleep.

targets.rawSql: select $__time(start_date), state from states where car_id = $car_id AND $__timeFilter(start_date) order by start_date desc limit 1;

panels.title: Current State

panels.description:
This dasboard is just to see the current state of the car with the last data recorded by TeslaMate.

Additionally, you can see the states stats of the selected period.

targets.rawSql: select $__time(start_date), state from states where car_id = $car_id AND $__timeFilter(start_date) order by start_date desc limit 1;

panels.title: Last state change

targets.rawSql:
SELECT $__time(date), range as "range_$length_unit"
FROM (
	(SELECT date, convert_km([[preferred_range]]_battery_range_km, '$length_unit') AS range
	FROM positions
	WHERE car_id = $car_id AND [[preferred_range]]_battery_range_km IS NOT NULL AND $__timeFilter(date)
  ORDER BY date DESC
	LIMIT 1)
	UNION ALL
	(SELECT date, convert_km([[preferred_range]]_battery_range_km, '$length_unit') AS range
	FROM charges c
	JOIN charging_processes p ON p.id = c.charging_process_id
	WHERE p.car_id = $car_id AND $__timeFilter(date)
	ORDER BY date DESC
	LIMIT 1)
) AS data
ORDER BY date DESC
LIMIT 1;

SELECT $__time(date), range as "range_$length_unit"
FROM (
	(SELECT date, convert_km(est_battery_range_km, '$length_unit') AS range
	FROM positions
	WHERE car_id = $car_id AND est_battery_range_km IS NOT NULL AND $__timeFilter(date)
  ORDER BY date DESC
	LIMIT 1)
	UNION ALL
	(SELECT date, convert_km(ideal_battery_range_km, '$length_unit') AS range
	FROM charges c
	JOIN charging_processes p ON p.id = c.charging_process_id
	WHERE p.car_id = $car_id AND $__timeFilter(date)
	ORDER BY date DESC
	LIMIT 1)
) AS data
ORDER BY date DESC
LIMIT 1;

(SELECT battery_level, date FROM positions WHERE car_id = $car_id AND $__timeFilter(date) ORDER BY date DESC LIMIT 1)
UNION
SELECT battery_level, date
FROM charges c
JOIN charging_processes p ON p.id = c.charging_process_id
WHERE $__timeFilter(date) AND p.car_id = $car_id
ORDER BY date DESC
LIMIT 1

SELECT
    convert_tire_pressure(tpms_pressure_fl,'$pressure_unit') AS "Front left",
    convert_tire_pressure(tpms_pressure_fr,'$pressure_unit') AS "Front right",
    convert_tire_pressure(tpms_pressure_rl,'$pressure_unit') AS "Rear left",
    convert_tire_pressure(tpms_pressure_rr,'$pressure_unit') AS "Rear right"
FROM
    positions
WHERE
    car_id = $car_id AND
    $__timeFilter(date) AND
    tpms_pressure_fl is not null
ORDER BY
    date DESC LIMIT 1

SELECT
  $__time(date),
  latitude,
  longitude
FROM positions
WHERE 
  car_id = $car_id AND 
  $__timeFilter(date)
ORDER BY 
  date ASC

SELECT
	$__time(date),
	convert_celsius(driver_temp_setting, '$temp_unit') as "Driver Temperature [째$temp_unit]"
FROM positions
WHERE driver_temp_setting IS NOT NULL AND car_id = $car_id AND $__timeFilter(date)
ORDER BY date DESC
LIMIT 1;

SELECT
  date,
  convert_celsius(inside_temp, '$temp_unit') AS "Inside Temperature [째$temp_unit]"
FROM positions
WHERE
  car_id = $car_id
  and inside_temp is not null AND $__timeFilter(date)
order by date desc
limit 1

WITH last_position AS (
	SELECT date, convert_celsius(outside_temp, '$temp_unit') AS "Outside Temperature [째$temp_unit]"
	FROM positions
	WHERE car_id = $car_id AND outside_temp IS NOT NULL AND $__timeFilter(date)
	ORDER BY date DESC
	LIMIT 1
),
last_charge AS (
	SELECT date, convert_celsius(outside_temp, '$temp_unit') AS "Outside Temperature [째$temp_unit]"
	FROM charges
	JOIN charging_processes ON charges.charging_process_id = charging_processes.id
	WHERE car_id = $car_id AND outside_temp IS NOT NULL AND $__timeFilter(date)
	ORDER BY date DESC
	LIMIT 1
)
SELECT * FROM last_position
UNION ALL
SELECT * FROM last_charge
ORDER BY date DESC 
LIMIT 1;

SELECT
  COALESCE(g.name, CONCAT_WS(', ', COALESCE(addresses.name, CONCAT_WS(' ', addresses.road, addresses.house_number)), addresses.city))
	FROM drives d
	LEFT JOIN addresses ON addresses.id = d.end_address_id
	LEFT JOIN geofences g ON g.id = d.end_geofence_id
WHERE
	 $__timeFilter(d.end_date) AND d.car_id = $car_id 
ORDER BY d.end_date DESC
LIMIT 1

WITH states AS (
  SELECT
    unnest(ARRAY [start_date + interval '1 second', end_date]) AS date,
    unnest(ARRAY [2, 0]) AS state
  FROM charging_processes
  WHERE
    car_id = $car_id AND 
    ($__timeFrom() :: timestamp - interval '30 day') < start_date AND 
    (end_date < ($__timeTo() :: timestamp + interval '30 day') OR end_date IS NULL)
  UNION
  SELECT
    unnest(ARRAY [start_date + interval '1 second', end_date]) AS date,
    unnest(ARRAY [1, 0]) AS state
  FROM drives
  WHERE
    car_id = $car_id AND 
    ($__timeFrom() :: timestamp - interval '30 day') < start_date AND 
    (end_date < ($__timeTo() :: timestamp + interval '30 day') OR end_date IS NULL)
  UNION
  SELECT
    start_date AS date,
    CASE
      WHEN state = 'offline' THEN 3
      WHEN state = 'asleep' THEN 4
      WHEN state = 'online' THEN 5
    END AS state
  FROM states
  WHERE
    car_id = $car_id AND 
    ($__timeFrom() :: timestamp - interval '30 day') < start_date AND 
    (end_date < ($__timeTo() :: timestamp + interval '30 day') OR end_date IS NULL)
  UNION
  SELECT
    unnest(ARRAY [start_date + interval '1 second', end_date]) AS date,
    unnest(ARRAY [6, 0]) AS state
  FROM updates
  WHERE
    car_id = $car_id AND 
    ($__timeFrom() :: timestamp - interval '30 day') < start_date AND 
    (end_date < ($__timeTo() :: timestamp + interval '30 day') OR end_date IS NULL)
), aux AS (
  SELECT $__timeFrom() :: timestamp AS date, (SELECT state FROM states WHERE date <= $__timeFrom() ORDER BY date DESC LIMIT 1) AS state, false AS include
  UNION
  SELECT date, state, true AS include FROM states
  UNION
  SELECT $__timeTo() :: timestamp as date, NULL AS state, true as include
  ORDER BY date
), states_elapsed AS (
  SELECT 
    date, state AS current_state, include,
    LAG(state) OVER (ORDER BY date) AS state,
    LAG(date) OVER (ORDER BY date) AS last_state_time,
    date - LAG(date) OVER (ORDER BY date) AS elapsed_time
  FROM aux 
)
SELECT 
    CASE
      WHEN state = 0 OR state = 5 THEN 'online'
      WHEN state = 1 THEN 'driving'
      WHEN state = 2 THEN 'charging'
      WHEN state = 3 THEN 'offline'
      WHEN state = 4 THEN 'asleep'
      WHEN state = 6 THEN 'updating'
    END AS state,
    EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM SUM(elapsed_time)) as Total_Time
FROM states_elapsed
WHERE $__timeFilter(date) AND include
GROUP BY 1

select convert_km(odometer::numeric, '$length_unit')  as "odometer_$length_unit"
from positions 
where car_id = $car_id AND $__timeFilter(date)
order by date desc 
limit 1;

select split_part(version, ' ', 1) as version 
from updates 
where car_id = $car_id AND start_date <= $__timeTo()
order by start_date desc 
limit 1

WITH states AS (
  SELECT
    unnest(ARRAY [start_date + interval '1 second', end_date]) AS date,
    unnest(ARRAY [2, 0]) AS state
  FROM charging_processes
  WHERE
    car_id = $car_id AND 
    ($__timeFrom() :: timestamp - interval '30 day') < start_date AND 
    (end_date < ($__timeTo() :: timestamp + interval '30 day') OR end_date IS NULL)
  UNION
  SELECT
    unnest(ARRAY [start_date + interval '1 second', end_date]) AS date,
    unnest(ARRAY [1, 0]) AS state
  FROM drives
  WHERE
    car_id = $car_id AND 
    ($__timeFrom() :: timestamp - interval '30 day') < start_date AND 
    (end_date < ($__timeTo() :: timestamp + interval '30 day') OR end_date IS NULL)
  UNION
  SELECT
    start_date AS date,
    CASE
      WHEN state = 'offline' THEN 3
      WHEN state = 'asleep' THEN 4
      WHEN state = 'online' THEN 5
    END AS state
  FROM states
  WHERE
    car_id = $car_id AND 
    ($__timeFrom() :: timestamp - interval '30 day') < start_date AND 
    (end_date < ($__timeTo() :: timestamp + interval '30 day') OR end_date IS NULL)
  UNION
  SELECT
    unnest(ARRAY [start_date + interval '1 second', end_date]) AS date,
    unnest(ARRAY [6, 0]) AS state
  FROM updates
  WHERE
    car_id = $car_id AND 
    ($__timeFrom() :: timestamp - interval '30 day') < start_date AND 
    (end_date < ($__timeTo() :: timestamp + interval '30 day') OR end_date IS NULL)
)
SELECT date AS "time", state
FROM states
WHERE 
  date IS NOT NULL AND
  ($__timeFrom() :: timestamp - interval '30 day') < date AND 
  date < ($__timeTo() :: timestamp + interval '30 day') 
ORDER BY date ASC, state ASC;

list.definition: SELECT name AS __text, id AS __value FROM cars ORDER BY display_priority ASC, name ASC;
list.label: Car
list.name: car_id
list.query: SELECT name AS __text, id AS __value FROM cars ORDER BY display_priority ASC, name ASC;
